Evaluation_Questions: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Comments_Questions: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
Comments_List: Progression of the German language. Better vocabulary and better discussion.
I improved my grammatical understanding somewhat and also my ability to hear German.
Knowledge about the culture of German speaking countries as well as German language ability were developed
My German writing, oral and grammar skills greatly improved and I learnt how to better communicate in German. I also learnt more about the German culture and how to give a presentation in German.

Good discussion and a good instructor. The textbook was frustrating at times and the grading harsh on occasion. The emails with a German student were also not useful at all and did not help me at all with learning better writing skills. I'd prefer reading a newspaper article and discussing it in class.

Strengths: class takes place every day, instructors really care, small class sizes make for more practice
Weaknesses: we kind of rush through the textbook to get everything done when we should probably just focus on the more important material and leave the unnecessary material out

A strength of the course is that I learnt a lot about the German culture while also learning more about the German language. Other strengths of the course are that there were many extracurricular activities offered by the German department that allowed me to improve my grade and practice my German more outside class time. Weaknesses of the course is that sometimes the flow of assignments were a little too heavy.
If you want to get to fluency, you should take L4 German.
I would recommend this naturally to anyone interested in improving their German language ability
I would highly recommend this course to another student since it improves your German language skills and presentation skills. It also improves your teamwork skills.
